content.en: Optimized compound extraction: Scientists have used algorithms to determine the best conditions for extracting various compounds from natural sources using supercritical carbon dioxide. These algorithms, such as Genetic Algorithm (GA), Response Surface Methodology (RSM), Grey Wolf Optimization (GWO), and Simulated Annealing (SA), help optimize the extraction process and improve the yield of valuable substances like nimbin, clove oil, β-carotene, epigallocatechin gallate, St. John's Wort, essential oils, isoflavones, and papaya seed oil. By utilizing these algorithms, researchers can find the most efficient and effective methods for extracting these compounds, which can have important applications in industries such as pharmaceuticals, cosmetics, and food production.
content.da: Optimeret forbindelseekstraktion: Forskere har brugt algoritmer til at bestemme de bedste betingelser for at udvinde forskellige forbindelser fra naturlige kilder ved hjælp af superkritisk kuldioxid. Disse algoritmer, såsom genetisk algoritme (GA), response surface methodology (RSM), grey wolf optimization (GWO) og simuleret annealing (SA), hjælper med at optimere ekstraktionsprocessen og forbedre udbyttet af værdifulde stoffer som nimbin, nellikeolie, β-caroten, epigallocatechin gallate, perikon, æteriske olier, isoflavoner og papayafrøolie. Ved at anvende disse algoritmer kan forskere finde de mest effektive og virkningsfulde metoder til at udvinde disse forbindelser, hvilket kan have vigtige anvendelser inden for industrier som farmaceutika, kosmetik og fødevareproduktion.
